TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Typeface extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents a combination of , , , and .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A typeface is a single variation of a font within the same font family. An example of a typeface is an italic version of the "Times New Roman" font family. Typeface defines the weight, style and stretching features of a font.

The font family that is used when a character is encountered that the primary font family (specified by the parameter) cannot display.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the specified font family name, , , and values. In addition, a fallback font family is specified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Passing `null` for the `fallbackFontFamily` parameter causes box characters to be displayed for characters not included in the primary font family.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property CapsHeight As Double
public: property double CapsHeight { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the distance from the baseline to the top of an English capital letter for the typeface.
Docs.value: A that indicates the distance from the baseline to the top of an English capital letter, expressed as a fraction of the font em size.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A return value of `1` indicates that the top of an English capital letter is one font em above the baseline, while a return value of `0.5` indicates that it is half a font em above the baseline.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsBoldSimulated As Boolean
public: property bool IsBoldSimulated { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Determines whether to simulate a bold weight for the glyphs represented by the .
Docs.value: if bold simulation is used for glyphs; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Media.Typeface> can simulate a bold weight by stretching a glyph. A non-simulated bold typeface is typically designed to have a better visual appearance than a simulated bold typeface.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsObliqueSimulated As Boolean
public: property bool IsObliqueSimulated { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Determines whether to simulate an italic style for the glyphs represented by the .
Docs.value: if italic simulation is used for glyphs; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Media.Typeface> can simulate an italic style by shearing, or slanting, a glyph. A non-simulated italic typeface is typically designed to have a better visual appearance than a simulated italic typeface.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Stretch As FontStretch
public: property System::Windows::FontStretch Stretch { System::Windows::FontStretch get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the stretch value for the . The stretch value determines whether a typeface is expanded or condensed when it is displayed.
Docs.value: A value that represents the stretch value for the typeface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A font stretch value describes the degree to which a font form is stretched from its normal aspect ratio, which is the original width to height ratio specified for the glyphs in the font.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property StrikethroughPosition As Double
public: property double StrikethroughPosition { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates the distance from the baseline to the strikethrough for the typeface.
Docs.value: A that indicates the strikethrough position, measured from the baseline and expressed as a fraction of the font em size.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A return value of `0.1` indicates that the strikethrough position is one-tenth of a font em above the baseline, while a return value of `0.25` indicates that its one-fourth of a font em above the baseline.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property StrikethroughThickness As Double
public: property double StrikethroughThickness { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates the thickness of the strikethrough relative to the font em size.
Docs.value: A that indicates the strikethrough thickness, expressed as a fraction of the font em size.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A return value of `0.05` indicates that the strikethrough thickness is one-twentieth of the font em size, while a return value of `0.1` indicates that the strikethrough thickness is one-tenth of the font em size.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Style As FontStyle
public: property System::Windows::FontStyle Style { System::Windows::FontStyle get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the style of the .
Docs.value: A value that represents the style value for the typeface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Three terms categorize the slant of a font: normal, oblique, and italic.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool TryGetGlyphTypeface([out] class System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface& glyphTypeface) cil managed
Public Function TryGetGlyphTypeface (ByRef glyphTypeface As GlyphTypeface) As Boolean

Docs.param: object that corresponds to this typeface, or if the typeface was constructed from a composite font.
Docs.summary: Retrieves the that corresponds to the .
Docs.returns: if the out parameter is set to a value; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Media.GlyphTypeface> is font face that directly corresponds to a font file on the disk. A <xref:System.Windows.Media.Typeface>, however, is a representation of font face.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property UnderlinePosition As Double
public: property double UnderlinePosition { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates the distance of the underline from the baseline for the typeface.
Docs.value: A that indicates the underline position, measured from the baseline and expressed as a fraction of the font em size.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The return value is usually negative, to place the underline below the baseline. For example, a return value of `-0.1` indicates that the underline position is one-tenth of a font em below the baseline, while a return value of `-0.25` indicates that it is one-fourth of a font em below the baseline.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property UnderlineThickness As Double
public: property double UnderlineThickness { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates the thickness of the underline relative to the font em size for the typeface.
Docs.value: A that indicates the underline thickness, expressed as a fraction of the font em size.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A return value of `0.05` indicates that the underline thickness is one-twentieth of the font em size, while a return value of `0.1` indicates that the underline thickness is one-tenth of the font em size.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Weight As FontWeight
public: property System::Windows::FontWeight Weight { System::Windows::FontWeight get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the relative weight of the typeface.
Docs.value: A value that represents the relative weight of the typeface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Weight differences are generally differentiated by an increased stroke or thickness associated with a given character in a typeface, as compared to a "normal" character from that same typeface.
**Note** Not all weights are available for all typefaces. When a weight is not available for a typeface, the closest matching weight is returned.
## Examples [!code-csharp[FontSnippets#110](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/FontSnippets/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#110)] [!code-vb[FontSnippets#110](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/FontSnippets/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#110)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property XHeight As Double
public: property double XHeight { double get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the distance from the baseline to the top of an English lowercase letter for a typeface. The distance excludes ascenders.
Docs.value: A that indicates the distance from the baseline to the top of an English lowercase letter (excluding ascenders), expressed as a fraction of the font em size.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A return value of `0.25` indicates that the top of an English letter is one-fourth of a font em above the baseline, while a return value of `0.75` indicates that the top of an English letter is three-fourths of a font em above the baseline.
